intro: Tryphostemma papillosum, commonly known as the featherleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are narrow and feather-like, giving the plant its common name. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many species in its family.
